page.title: 02Crocadon Dairy Farm
page.content: On this 300 acre{Dairy}farm the tenant farmer, Mr.Bush, runs 300{cattle}. He has 110 Freisian cows which he uses primarily for{milk}production. The cows are milked twice daily at 0630 and at 1600 hrs in a milking parlour. The milk is collected at midday by tanker lorry and taken to the MMB depot at Plymouth. Mr.Bush owns a prize pedigree herd and maintains this high bloodstock by selective breeding with his own bulls (1 bull cost Â£10000) or buying in new stock from abroad if neccesary. eg 1 American Holstein Freisian. Each autumn he clears out a large shed and holds an auction selling off bulls and heifers. In winter the livestock are fed on {silage}and corncake, but go out to grass during late spring, summer and early autumn.
